medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva with severe progressive heterotopic ossification.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient, diagnosed at three years old, showed progressive heterotopic ossification of the axial skeletal muscles and connective tissues. Initial lesions formed in the cervical, scapular, and paraspinous soft tissues during the first decade of life, limiting movement of the neck, shoulders, and back. At age ten, he developed easy bruisability, nosebleeds, and pallor, with laboratory findings indicating severe aplastic anemia. Fibrodysplasia ossificans progressiva flare-ups diminished in intensity and frequency during aplastic anemia.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Aplastic anemia treated with bone marrow transplantation at age ten; history of immunosuppression following transplantation.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's HLA-identical older sister was the donor for bone marrow transplantation, and she was healthy with no musculoskeletal or immunological disorders.
